intro: Matthiola fenestralis, commonly known as the windowflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and long blooming period.
